H0.text: Nucleus, electrons, and quarks are the particles that make up an atom.

H1.text: Protons, neutrons, and electrons are the particles that make up an atom.

H2.text: Ionic bonds, covalent bonds, and ions describe the particles that make up an atom.

H3.text: The particles that make up an atom are the nucleus, electron cloud, and energy levels.

A4.text: Protons are composed of two up quarks of charge +2/3 e each, and one down quark of charge âˆ’1/3 e.

A5.text: Protons and neutrons, each with a mass of approximately one dalton, are jointly referred to as nucleons (particles present in atomic nuclei).

A6.text: Neutrons are found, together with a similar number of protons in the nuclei of atoms.

A7.text: Neutrons are not elementary particles; each is composed of three quarks.
